The vaccine may have unintended side effects on the recipients.
The vaccine may be too expensive to produce and distribute, making it inaccessible to those who need it most.
The vaccine may not be able to reach all parts of the population, leading to pockets of unvaccinated individuals.
The vaccine may be vulnerable to mutation or resistance by the disease.
The vaccine may not be able to be stored or transported properly, leading to spoilage or loss of effectiveness.
